summary: The Pitcairn Islands are a small group of four islands in the Pacific Ocean, belonging to Britain. They are famous for being home to descendants of sailors who mutinied on the ship Bounty. Most of the islands are uninhabited, with only Pitcairn Island having people living there. There are only about 47 people living on the island as of 2020. The islanders have a unique culture, blending English and Tahitian traditions.
title: Pitcairn Islands
